title: Mid-Level Systems & Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Jeppesen, a subsidiary of The Boeing Company, is one of the largest aeronautical data vendors in Europe. We develop innovative optimization solutions for the world's leading airlines. We are dedicated to continuous improvement, delivering more value to our clients, and exploring emerging technologies such as quantum computing, AI and big data analytics.

Jeppesen is looking for a Mid-Level Systems & Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Gdańsk, Poland.

The Systems & Data Analyst provides engineering-level Technical Support for the Jeppesen Chart Product.Resolves problems and questions... regarding aeronautical content, format or errors/omissions in products that are raised from Tier 1 Support, Sales/Services or received as direct inquiries from customers.Communicates directly with customers via email, phone or web.Investigates product functional issues and determines appropriate actions for resolution.Serves as key contact point (liaison) between the customer and internal data production groups.Records customer interaction and resolution details in a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Data Standards and Product Management.Provides input on new product implementations as well as current product modifications.

Responsibilities:
• Provide customer-facing Technical Support for Boeing/Jeppesen Charts
• Resolve problems and answer inquiries relating to the aeronautical content in Boeing/Jeppesen Charts
• Investigate sophisticated technical issues and provide recommended solutions to customers and internal partners
• Considerable ability to maintain effective working relationships in a team environment
• Build team technical capability through sharing of knowledge & expertise with others
• Support data design and research efforts and communicate solutions to multi-functional teams
• Perform other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications:
• 3 or more years of experience with Boeing/Jeppesen Chart authoring, product specifications and schedules, government-issued navigation data documents (AIP, AIP AMDT/SUP, AICs, FAA Form 8260s, NFDDs, etc.) and Instrument Flight Procedures

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or higher
• Experience with multiple charting assets
• Knowledge of chart delivery procedures
• Knowledge of Jeppesen Airway Manual
• Some knowledge of Boeing/Jeppesen electronic chart products
• Experience with Salesforce CRM
• Pilot or dispatch experience

On Saturday, 12 March 2022, the President of the Republic of Poland signed a law to assist citizens of Ukraine in connection with the armed conflict in that country. As part of this law, Ukrainian refugees in Poland benefit from access to the Polish labor market. Boeing welcomes applications from Ukrainian refugees who are seeking employment in Poland.

Typical education and experience: Acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an similar combination (e.g. PhD, Master and 3 years or a total of 9 years, etc.). Applicable and appropriate certification credentials from an accredited institution and/or corresponding experience is required.

Relocation: This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Export Control Requirements: Not an export control position

Equal Opportunity Employer:

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.

We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world's most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process

title: Senior Data Analyst I
description:
Senior Data Analyst I(

Job Number:
78006488D20221228)Flexible Work Eligible:None

DISCOVER your opportunity

Senior Data Analyst I

Wroclaw/Poland

AXA XL recognizes data and information as critical business assets, both in terms of managing risk and enabling new business opportunities. This data should be high quality and actionable – enabling AXA XL’s executive leadership team to create a sustained competitive advantage.

Our Data, Intelligence & Analytics team (DIA) is driving innovation through leveraging data to drive strategy and create a new business model – disrupting the insurance market. Our Data Quality team supports our Enterprise Stewardship Network Data Owners and Stewards by providing Data quality levels monitoring, reporting, and improvement of Critical Data Elements. As we develop our enterprise-wide data strategy, the Senior Data Analyst I will implement a Data Quality across systems and data elements to support implementation of Data Quality strategy for AXA XL to... become a data driven organization

The Senior Data Analyst I must demonstrate strong analytical skills to perform data analysis on operational data from external and internal sources, interpreting the data, doing root cause analysis and reporting to respective stakeholders.

The role requires working across the organization to document business requirements, analysis the data to help define proper business requirements, build quality rules, visualize results, and support business to improve data. The individual will become the local point of contact for developing and implementing data quality rules for given business domains.

DISCOVER your opportunity

What will your essential responsibilities include?
Lead Data Quality analysis assessments on the Big Data environment Collaborate with stakeholders to mobilize Data Quality project requirements Perform root cause analysis, investigating any data errors or anomalies and implement solutions to correct data problems Develop metrics and reports supporting data quality initiatives Develop complex SQL scripts to retrieve data from strategic systems Participate in Scrum teams and work in agile methodology on an ambitious strategic project Collaborate with other teams (inside and outside function) to improve Data Quality (CI initiatives) within the organization Plays an important role coordinating and delivering activities, programs, projects and services, relying on judgment gained from seasoned experience May work in multiple extreme teams, internal projects applying technical depth and breadth of knowledge Consistently demonstrates initiative and is relied on to be proactive in identifying and communicating needs Improve the existing process through suggesting continuous improvement ideas and implementing them successfully

You will report to Data Quality Lead and support the Division Leads and Global Leads – Data Quality & Culture, Data Management.

SHARE your talent

SHARE your talent

We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:

Required Skills and Abilities:
Graduated/Post graduated in Computer Science, Mathematics, Insurance domain preferably Experience 2+ years in data area (preferred Data Quality or Data management) Intermediate in SQL with the good understanding of database structures Good knowledge of MS Office (Microsoft Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, access etc.) Excellent Communication skills (fluency in English) Analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Ability to work with team globally located and cross-functionally to achieve the goal Detail Oriented, ability to analyze and identify discrepancies. Must be an independent learner and quickly understands the processes

Desired Skills and Abilities:
Knowledgeable for Power Bi, Power Apps environment with practical experience Practical VBA experience will Practical experience with Data Quality Tools (Collibra or Informatica) Hands on experience of working in projects managed with Agile methodology

FIND your future

AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.

With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward

title: Analytics Solutions- Data Analyst Associate
description:
Job Description

The Strategy. Governance, and Execution (SGE) Support Team is aligned to the Chief Technology Office (CTO) within Enterprise Technology (ET). We harvest, clean, and analyze data to develop reports and visualizations/dashboards for Lines of Business(LOB™s) and cross-functional groups (CF™s) across the enterprise.

The duties will encompass end-to-end requirements, planning and execution of work- inclusive of design, test execution, and implementation. The successful candidate must possess strong analytical problem-solving skills, be an expert using Alteryx and Tableau, with strong prioritization and time management skills

Key Responsibilities:
• Harvest data from existing API™s.
• Validate, scrub, standardize, and blend incoming data.
• Collaborate with stakeholders, as appropriate, to build Data Analytics and Visualizations.
• Update & maintain user-facing documentation via Confluence pages. (e.g. report logic & definitions, process diagrams, how-to instructions... etc.).
• Document progress of required methodology steps via JIRA.

Core Qualifications:
• Minimum of 1 year of related work experience using Alteryx and Tableau, along with MS Office (specifically Excel)
• Gathering and documenting business requirements
• Fluent in English (written and verbal)
• Demonstrated basic project and effective time management skills (goal setting, planning, prioritizing, scheduling) with attention to detail, results orientation, and a focus on efficiency
• Basic written and verbal communication skills for use across multiple audiences
• Ability to partner with internal stakeholders and tech areas to drive projects
• Analytical and problem solving skills
• Good understanding of best practices in project management
• Ability to work in a fast paced, results driven environment
• Team and detail oriented

Additional Preferred Skills:
• Software: Confluence, JIRA
• Client/Customer Support Experience

About Us
• JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. With over 240,000 employees, we serve millions of consumers, small businesses, and many of the world™s most prominent corporate, institutional, and government clients. Our major business units include Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Bank, Commercial Banking, and Consumer & Community Banking.
• We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants™ and employees™ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Location: Bydgoszcz Department: Relativity Service Delivery Work Status: Full-time

Overview
Are you looking to be in a workplace where colleagues inspire one another? Are you interested in competitive and impactful benefits? Do you prefer flexible work arrangements?The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Service Delivery department in advanced data analysis and reporting. You will participate in projects that partner with multiple areas of the business, as well as help with goal setting and KPIs. Your strong analytical and reporting skills will allow you to report on Service Delivery metrics and make meaningful recommendations that advance the priorities and efficiency of the team. You’ll work closely with Service Delivery leaders on target setting, capacity planning, customer experience reporting, performance reporting and other data analysis projects.

Role Responsibilities
Accountable in being the subject matter expert as it pertains to data governance for Service... Delivery. Create moderate to complex reporting solutions (Tableau, SalesForce) based on existing datasets Run, interpret and share data and performance results with stakeholders, including standardized reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis from various inputs (Salesforce, JIRA, telephony solution, etc.) using various outputs (Excel, PPT, Tableau). Surface insights and contribute to planning through accurate reporting and data analysis for our Service Delivery teams. Assist in the discovery work needed for Service Delivery Operations programs, including but not limited to, data collection, scrubbing and presenting. Report on departmental and team goals, maintain dashboards, and provide data analysis to your leader to make strong recommendations that meaningfully contribute to Relativity’s Service Delivery strategy. Adhere to best practices in reporting and data quality that allow the Service Delivery team to accurately report on key activities. Participate in business-critical operational projects that partner, collaborate, and strategize with teams inside and outside of Service Delivery. Run ad hoc projects as needed that are data driven, focusing on success metrics specific to teams.

Minimum Qualifications
Experience with a SaaS or subscription-based software company. Intermediate knowledge of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on Excel 1+ years experience building or enhancing dashboards within data visualization tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik) Familiarity with SQL and relational databases Familiarity with statistical analysis / data mining techniques and software Ability to analyze and document complex business processes. Apply Now

title: Graduate Programme - Trainee Graduate Data Analyst
description:
With a rapidly expanding client base, Vantage Point is looking to hire Data Analyst with a strong academic background in data science, statistics and/or mathematics to join our ambitious and fast growing Team. This will be a client-facing role (following a fast tracked training process) and you will be working on client site in Warsaw. Employed under our innovative AdVantage Accelerator Programme, this is a 18 month scheme.
• University degree in a data science, statistical, mathematical, accountancy or finance degree or other relevant subject.
• Experience of working within analytics and/or data science is beneficial but not essential
• A real passion for data and analytics
• Excellent communication skills (Must be Fluent in Polish and English) ability to generate ideas and execute them effectively
• The ability to organise time, learn quickly and work well under pressure
• Deliver focused and strong attention to detail
• An Analytical Mind
• Confident, Ambitious, Client focused... attitude
• Strong entrepreneurial, analytical, quantitative and client relations' skills.
• Eligibility to work in Poland at the time of starting employment. Please note, we are not able to sponsor work visas.

What We Are Offering
• Training in Investment Banking business knowledge
• All relevant technical and analytical training
• A fantastic starting point for a career in Banking
• Dynamic and exciting environment
• Excellent experience

If you feel that you meet the criteria of the Graduate Business Consultant then please apply! Deadlines

This program has a start date for the beginning of March 2023. We are recruiting on a rolling basis so please apply earlier for consideration. We look forward to receiving you application.

Vantage Point is a leading Consultancy dealing with Top Investment Banks and Buy-Side Financial Services Businesses. Our areas of specialism include Process Engineering, Data Operations, Front-Back Office Operations, Regulatory Compliance and Risk.

We are focused on recruiting the brightest graduate talent. We hire people with passion that demonstrate that they have what it takes to succeed in the Financial Services industry. Through our experience we have created the Vantage Point Advantage Accelerator Programme, this unique Model delivers formal training, personal development and mentoring to create high calibre, highly skilled Change Professionals

title: Data Analyst
description:
Description

Zadania:
generowanie raportów z baz danych; obróbka danych w CSV/XLS(X)/JSON; przygotowanie analiz technicznych; praca nad tworzeniem i rozwojem narzędzi na potrzeby automatyzacji codziennych zadań; przygotowanie dokumentacji; wsparcie zespołu Technical Account Managerów.

Wymagania:
bardzo dobra znajomość SQL; bardzo dobra znajomość Google Data Studio lub analogicznych narzędzi; bardzo dobra znajomość Google Sheets lub analogicznych narzędzi; dobra znajomość NodeJS lub Python; dobra znajomość GIT; dobra znajomość Linux; komunikatywny angielski; chęć do nauki i rozwoju.

Mile widziane:
znajomość BigQuery; znajomość Google Analytics; znajomość Jupyter Notebook; znajomość ElasticSearch/Kibana; znajomość Jenkins; znajomość PostgreSQL; doświadczenie w branży reklamowej.

Oferujemy:
udział w jednym z najciekawszych projektów branży online w Polsce; atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie; dofinansowanie do nauki języków oraz budżet szkoleniowy; możliwość zdobycia doświadczenia w dziedzinie... RTB - najszybciej i najlepiej rozwijającym się obszarze reklamy internetowej; ciągły rozwój zawodowy oraz możliwość podnoszenia kwalifikacji; przyjazną atmosferę pracy

title: Digital Data Analyst
description:
Digital Data AnalystMiejsce pracy: Warszawa

Hello! Właśnie poszukujemy do naszego zespołu Data Science – Web Analityka 😎
Jeśli analiza i interpretacja danych to coś, co sprawia Ci przyjemność, śmigasz w GA4, GSC i Data Studio, a do tego “czujesz miętę” do digitalu to zdecydowanie czytaj dalej... 😉
Jesteśmy jedną z największych agencji digitalowych w Polsce, a dziś zapraszamy Cię do naszego świata - podeślij nam swoje CV i sprawdź, czy do siebie pasujemy!
Twój zakres obowiązków:

analiza i interpretacja danych z zakresu kampanii marketingowych oraz zachowania użytkowników na stronach internetowych
przygotowywanie dashboardów, raportów i prezentacji dla marek o światowym zasięgu
koordynacja i realizacja programów badawczych w obszarze Digital Marketingu
współtworzenie i rozwijanie narzędzia Business Intelligence
współpraca z osobami odpowiedzialnymi za projekty PPC, SEO, SM
praca w środowisku Google API
praca nad wizualizacją danych i automatyzacją raportów (Data Studio... Looker)

Nasze wymagania:

jesteś studentem/ką ostatnich lat lub absolwentem/ką kierunków Data Science/Analiza danych
świetnie poruszasz się w środowisku narzędzi Google – Analytics 4, Google Search Console - w stopniu zaawansowanym
znasz język R i wiesz jak w nim zautomatyzować: pobieranie, przetwarzanie, ładowanie i wizualizowanie danych
jesteś odpowiedzialny/a i zorganizowany/a - potrafisz samodzielnie układać swoją pracę
wykazujesz się inicjatywą, chcesz testować nowe pomysły i chętnie dzielisz się swoja wiedzą
język angielski znasz na poziomie swobodnej komunikacji (min. B2)

Mile widziane:

doświadczenie pracy w agencji marketingowej
umiejętność tworzenia aplikacji z pakietem R Shiny
doświadczenie z relacyjnymi bazami danych (MySQL) i/lub nierelacyjnymi bazami danych (MongoDB)
znajomość i doświadczenie w korzystaniu z modeli uczenia maszynowego

To oferujemy:

Szerokie możliwości rozwoju dla Ciebie – szkolenia, warsztaty, dzielenie się wiedzą, konferencje branżowe - a to dopiero początek! 🌟
Zgrany i doświadczony team, który nie tylko będzie Cię wspierał, lecz także chętnie nauczy się czegoś nowego od Ciebie 🙌
Biuro bez korpo klimatu – w willi z ogródkiem na Mokotowie, w sąsiedztwie parku 🏡
Wiele okazji do poznania i polubienia tych, z którymi pracujesz (grille, eventy i każda okazja do wspólnego funu to nasze drugie imię! 🥳)
Pakiet benefitów dla Ciebie: wsparcie psychologiczne, opieka medyczna, karta Multisport, ubezpieczenie grupowe, platforma do rozwoju osobistego, nauka języków obcych i kilka innych, o których opowiemy Ci na rozmowie rekrutacyjnej!

Dołącz do nas i przekonaj się, jak fajnie może być w pracy! 😉
Administratorem danych jest Performance Media P.S.A. (dawniej Performance Media spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością sp.k.) z siedzibą w Warszawie, ul. Idzikowskiego 19, 02-704 Warszawa (dalej „PM”). Podanie danych jest dobrowolne, są one wykorzystywane w dla celów rekrutacji prowadzonych przez PM, na podstawie zgody lub na żądanie Kandydata (art. 6 ust. 1 lit. a oraz lit. f RODO). Dane mogą być przekazywane podmiotom, z pomocą których PM prowadzi rekrutacje. Istnieje możliwość cofnięcia zgody lub zgłoszenia sprzeciwu wobec przetwarzania danych, żądania do nich dostępu, sprostowania, usunięcia, ograniczenia przetwarzania oraz przeniesienia. Dane przechowywane są do cofnięcia zgody lub zgłoszenia sprzeciwu. Każdemu przysługuje prawo skargi do organu nadzorczego ds. ochrony danych. Pytania dot. dziedziny prywatności w PM prosimy kierować pod adres: rodo [malpka@] performance-media.pl

Wyrażam zgodę na przetwarzanie moich danych osobowych zawartych w zgłoszeniu rekrutacyjnym oraz w dostarczonych dokumentach aplikacyjnych, przez Performance Media P.S.A. (dawniej Performance Media spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością sp.k.) z siedzibą w Warszawie, do celów związanych z uczestnictwem w procesie rekrutacyjnym. Zapoznałem/am się z treścią klauzuli informacyjnej, w tym z informacją o celu i sposobach przetwarzania danych osobowych oraz prawach przysługujących mi w związku z przetwarzaniem. Przyjmuję do wiadomości, że odnośnie danych osobowych przetwarzanych na podstawie zgody, może ona być w każdej chwili cofnięta.

Osoby zainteresowane ofertą pracy prosimy o przesyłanie swojego CV klikając w przycisk "Aplikuj teraz

title: Mid-Level Systems & Data Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Jeppesen, a subsidiary of The Boeing Company, is one of the largest aeronautical data vendors in Europe. We develop innovative optimization solutions for the world’s leading airlines. We are dedicated to continuous improvement, delivering more value to our clients, and exploring emerging technologies such as quantum computing, AI and big data analytics.

Jeppesen is looking for a Mid-Level Systems & Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Gdańsk, Poland.

The Systems & Data Analyst provides engineering-level Technical Support for the Jeppesen Chart Product. Resolves problems and questions... regarding aeronautical content, format or errors/omissions in products that are raised from Tier 1 Support, Sales/Services or received as direct inquiries from customers. Communicates directly with customers via email, phone or web. Investigates product functional issues and determines appropriate actions for resolution. Serves as key contact point (liaison) between the customer and internal data production groups. Records customer interaction and resolution details in a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system. Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Data Standards and Product Management. Provides input on new product implementations as well as current product modifications.

Responsibilities:
• Provide customer-facing Technical Support for Boeing/Jeppesen Charts
• Resolve problems and answer inquiries relating to the aeronautical content in Boeing/Jeppesen Charts
• Investigate sophisticated technical issues and provide recommended solutions to customers and internal partners
• Considerable ability to maintain effective working relationships in a team environment
• Build team technical capability through sharing of knowledge & expertise with others
• Support data design and research efforts and communicate solutions to multi-functional teams
• Perform other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications:
• 3 or more years of experience with Boeing/Jeppesen Chart authoring, product specifications and schedules, government-issued navigation data documents (AIP, AIP AMDT/SUP, AICs, FAA Form 8260s, NFDDs, etc.) and Instrument Flight Procedures

Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or higher
• Experience with multiple charting assets
• Knowledge of chart delivery procedures
• Knowledge of Jeppesen Airway Manual
• Some knowledge of Boeing/Jeppesen electronic chart products
• Experience with Salesforce CRM
• Pilot or dispatch experience

On Saturday, 12 March 2022, the President of the Republic of Poland signed a law to assist citizens of Ukraine in connection with the armed conflict in that country. As part of this law, Ukrainian refugees in Poland benefit from access to the Polish labor market. Boeing welcomes applications from Ukrainian refugees who are seeking employment in Poland.

Typical education and experience: Acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an similar combination (e.g. PhD, Master and 3 years or a total of 9 years, etc.). Applicable and appropriate certification credentials from an accredited institution and/or corresponding experience is required.

Relocation: This position does not offer relocation. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Export Control Requirements: Not an export control position

Equal Opportunity Employer:

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not accept unlawful discrimination in our recruitment or employment practices on any grounds including but not limited to; color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military and veteran status, or other characteristics covered by applicable law.

We have teams in more than 65 countries, and each person plays a role in helping us become one of the world’s most innovative, diverse and inclusive companies. Applicants are encouraged to share with our recruitment team any accommodations required during the recruitment process

title: Research & Development (R&D) Data Analyst
description:
For our client we are looking for technical person, fluent in English, with a very good knowledge of SAP and EXCL - to work in an international company as a data analyst

what we offer
• Temporary job for a 12 months (or more)
• benefit packages,
• work in a company that enables development and gives support,
• possibility of hybrid work,

your tasks

engagement objectives – understand the work to be done
